titleInfo.title: Grand Ole Opry - Royal Crown Cola - 1947-12-27 - Excerpts // Prince Albert - 1947-12-27 - Excerpt

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Excerpts from a Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:00-9:30 pm) from December 27, 1947. Featuring Louie Buck (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bradley Kincaid, and guest Curley Williams. Followed by an excerpt from a Prince Albert sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:30-10:00 pm) from December 27, 1947. Featuring Red Foley (host/performer), and performers Rod Brasfield, and Wally Fowler. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
